page.title: 01 THE COUNTRY FAIR 1985
page.content: A COUNTRY FAIR WAS HELD IN THE FIELDS INSIDE THE PARK GATE AT CHIPPING WARDEN ON AUGUST 25th 1985.IT COVERED 11 ACRES AND EXTENDED INTO THE GARDEN OF THE SPRING HOUSE.IT WAS OPENED AT 2 0'CLOCK BY MRS SERGISON BROOKS AND WAS VERY WELL ATTENDED.THE ATTRACTIONS INCLUDED AN EXHIBITION OF VILLAGE LIFE SHOWN IN PHOTOS;ALSO ARTISTS PAINTINGS,ALL DISPLAYED INSIDE THE CHURCH.A MAIN ARENA WITH A BAND, MAJORETTES AND PONY AND TRAPS.DOG SHOWS ,RIFLE RANGE,CYCLE CROSS,STALLS,SIDE SHOWS ,CRAFTS,SWINGS AND ROUNDABOUTS, ALL PROVED POPULAR.IN A SEPARATE FIELD, MEMBERS OF THE MG CLUB DISPLAYED THEIR CARS,AND WELL AWAY FROM THE CROWDS A CLAY PIGEON SHOOT WAS IN PROGRESS ALL AFTERNOON.NEARLY EVERY FAMILY IN THE VILLAGE HELPED IN SOME WAY 701 pounds WAS RASIED TOWARDS A MINI BUS FOR THE PRIMARY SCHOOL.
